basics.name: Emillia E. Noordhoek
basics.summary: I am an energetic thinker delivering strategic global solutions to enable restoration of our climate and ecology. I am happily enlisiting my humble leadership to improving the functioning of our democracies to facilitate people-led climate action and energy justice on a human scale.

work.summary: Helping to strengthen and launch community-driven and volunteer-powered projects, develop, adopt meaningful community engagement strategies, and harness the power of the social web for social good. This work is guided by 13 years of prior experience working with community-based economic, environmental and energy initiatives in the Hawaiian Islands
highlights: Co-founded the Tentou Network, an international renewable energy cohort of 5 organizations seeking to follow the example lead by Samso Island, Denmark as a 100% renewable energy island model for the world. We learned and taught over the course of two plus years Design Thinking concepts, leadhership development from the lessons learned on Samso how best to engagne and integrate the local communities into creating sustianable futures for eeryone.

Project Community Liaison and Development lead for Groundswell: Created communication actiivy plans for the engagement of the first community Renewable Energy(RE) project between Molokai Community, Utility, Land Owner, RE Development Team and Government liasons.
Developed the content and evaluated outcomes with varying communications channels of key stakeholders invovled with the successful outcomes of the Community Renewable Energy Project.

work.summary: Built financial solvancy from the ground up through creative fundraising, grantwriting, and donor development, increased the annual budget 100% to $600,000 by the end of my tenor
highlights: Crafted and implemented plans to ensure the growth of our base throughout Hawaii and Molokai.
Created new business opportunities within the public sector by networking, attending fairs, meetings social media,and more.
Track and present  programing and sales results and forecasts.
Built lasting customer relationships by understanding their needs.
Identified industry trends and shifts. Adjusted to acquire growth while retaining our organizational values.

Coordinated and executed daily organizational operations  including: program implementation; community relations and organizing; program evaluation; staff and management of 6-10 team members and 30 plus volunteers; and oversight of high net worth budget.
Secured $9.6 million in public financing through the Hawaii Green Infrastructure Authority to provide revolving loans for 1,200 homes to participate in a solar water heater exchange program.

Developed, coordniated, Monitered and evaluated all aspects of the the HUI UP! Program, providing energy efficient appliances to lower income ratepayers. We impacted over 1000 homes by exchanging 36,000 incandescent light bulbs for CFLs and over 1000  energy effecient refrigerators a projected savings to residents of over $1,000,000.00 in energy costs over the next 10 years.

Developed, coordinated efforts for Kamalo Restoration Project, repurposing defunct quarry land into a viable bamboo farm as a carbon sink and material for biomass energy products. Pioneered sustianable financial models as an income stream for visitors to Hawaii to  offset their carbon footprint.
Designed, funded, coordinated and built first off grid sustainable and loacally sourced bambo home on Sustianable Molokai Educational Perma Culture Farm

work.summary: Capitilized on the mission to build sustianable affordable housing by forming new business and brand partnerships, increasing volunteers, donations by over 50%.
highlights: Coordinated project feasibility, developed and managed project budgets, secured $1.2 million in project financing from private and public sources to build homes for local families and renovate existing housing stock with energy efficiency and solar.
Coordinated with local and national EPA officials to create policy for Hawaii Energy Star certification for housing throughout the state resulting in the first EPA certified Energy Star homes.
Project manager of the first energy-independent, off grid bamboo kit home for Moloka‘i Habitat for Humanity.

Raised legislative awareness on affordable housing issues by creating policy to integrate renewable energy systems, monitering the high cost of energy as a “hidden cost” of housing that burdens low-income families creating a larger carbon footprint with little resouces to over come the fossil fuel economy.

Developed, Coordniated, Monitered and Evaluated all aspects of the Global Village program for a net $0 income USd to a viabrant and dynmic, growing income stream generating well over $100,000 USD annually for building afforndable sustainable housing. thisincluded the important  steps of a  ftwo-three year  business  and marketing plan for on a global level, as the Global Village is a part of the  HAbitat for Humanity International global fundraising programs.
Founding architect of community based art center developing the finanical infrastructure, art programing, cultivating artist in residents, streghtening longterm sustainablity.
Leadership role for the Hawaii Democratics  for Molokai, Laniai and parts of Maui Island seizing the political will and opportunity to effect dramatic changes  through the party in local leadership.

Organized and monitered local polling places for 2016 presidential caucuses, coordinated precinct presidents in order to moniter and report the votes accurately in a contested and sometimes hostile field of engaged citizens.
Worked with the Hawaii State Democratic Party state convention to ensure an appropriate number of delegates to each candidate for the national democratic conventions.

Created three different Policy resolutions for the Hawaii State Democratic Party regarding Climate Change that were then evaluated, and accepted as parts of the Democratic Platform addressing climate change mitigation through Agriculture, and the use of fossil fuels.

education.institution: Portland State University, School of Urban Planning

education.institution: The University of Oregon, School of Architecture and Allied Arts

awards.title: Omidyar Fellowship- Forum of Fellows
awards.summary: Omidyar Fellows is an enduring and ongoing commitment to an active network of leaders and change-makers, committed to ongoing development of our leadership.

awards.title: Hawai’i Investment Ready-Cohort III
awards.summary: HIR is a two-year program designed to help social ventures better understand and scale their impact and business models, and to assist them in accessing resources to implement their next level of growth. Worked with coaches and venture capital to take the abstract vision that was vaguely articulated at the closing of the conference and transmute the various intentions that made up this abstraction into a thriving tangible entity that continues to produce value for the island of Molokai. In starting and building Sustainable Molokai I showed my ability to transform disintegrated resources into an aggregated tangible expression of the vision of the community of Molokai.

awards.title: Hawai’i Alliance for Progressive Action
awards.summary: The core of HAPA’s mission is to catalyze community empowerment and systemic change - a change that goes to the root of our social, economic and environmental injustices. In order to fulfill that mission, HAPA believes that Hawai‘i needs more progressive government leaders who value ʻāina (environment or 'that which feeds') and people ahead of corporate profit. The fellowship allowed me to create greater connections throughout the state of Hawaii through political parties and assist in running people for office, increasing my capacity for community organizing, and working with candidates on a local state and national context for powerful change.

publications.name: Molokai Agriculture Assessment
publications.summary: Molokaipedia and the Agriculture Needs Assessment. Molokaipedia is a project undertaken by Sustainable Molokai for the purpose of creating stronger community networks; informing key stakeholders; increasing equity and access to public and private partnerships and resources; and mobilizing our people to build as well as measure our progress towards a sustainable future.

publications.name: Molokai Energy Assessment
publications.summary: The purpose of this report is to present an overview of the energy situation on Molokai although Molokai is currently powered almost entirely*by imported fossil fuel there is significant evidence that our small island community has the potential to become energy independent based on our* history, our current practices and attitudes,and the fact that renewable energy technology*is readily available. This document is intended to demonstrate that evidence in detail, and to provide information that the community can utilize to make decision for its energy future.

interests.name: American politics, sustainable building and bamboo building nerd; Triathlon competition, rainforests, my beautiful dog, Japanese pottery, sourdough bread and bread ovens
